title: When custom scopes are defined, but none are specified as "default", an error happens when searching
body:
` revision: 417ff4be6d44ef2ef4b35e24f25ac686478f9e3c`

### Expected behavior

specifying a "default" scope, should not be necessary

### Actual behavior

ActionView::Template::Error: undefined method `name' for nil:NilClass

```````

```````

### How to reproduce

1. Define a scope in the model

`````
class User < ActiveRecord::Base
  scope :admins, -> { where(admin: true) }
end
`````

2. Define the matching scope in the active_admin level, do not specify it being the "default"

`````
ActiveAdmin.register User do
  scope :all
  scope :admins
end
`````

3. Search anything using a filter

### How to temporarily fix

`````
ActiveAdmin.register User do
  scope :all, default: true
  scope :admins
end
`````
